content.rendered:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_custom_heading text=”Schedule an Appointment” font_container=”tag:h2|text_align:center” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_custom_heading text=”Services Offered: Air Duct, Dryer Vent, Chimney, Heating & Cooling System, Home Insulation” font_container=”tag:h4|font_size:15px|text_align:center” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=”.vc_custom_1522641232194{margin-top: 40px !important;}”][vc_column width=”1/2″ offset=”vc_col-md-6″ css=”.vc_custom_1522630899283{background-color: #ffffff !important;border-radius: 2px !important;}”]

    * Required field.

    [/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_single_image image=”16108″ img_size=”large” alignment=”center”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_custom_heading text=”How Clean Is Your Chimney” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text]Do you have a foul smell coming from your fireplace? Does your house smell like smoke even though you haven’t lit a fire in days or weeks?  If you answered ‘yes’ to either of these questions, it could indicate that your home’s chimney has accumulated creosote.

    Creosote is the soot byproduct that comes from burning wood. Every fireplace (except, of course, an electric one) generates creosote. If you don’t clean this build-up regularly, it can lead to severe airflow and health problems over time.

    For example, creosote or soot buildup reduces the airflow, which not only impacts the performance of the fireplace and chimney but also increases the risk of carbon monoxide poisoning. This is why experts recommend getting your chimney, vents, and fireplaces inspected at least once each year.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width=”stretch_row” css=”.vc_custom_1629320178553{background-color: #4169e1 !important;}”][vc_column][vc_column_text]

    Call us today at 866-847-7454 or contact us online to schedule a chimney inspection.

    [/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_custom_heading text=”How We Can Help” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text]United Home Services has been providing professional chimney cleaning and inspection services for over 20 years. We use field-tested equipment and industry expterise to ensure the safety and cleanliness of your home’s chimney.

    We can clear out the dangerous, crusty, and highly combustible soot (creosote), and also get rid of any critters (like bats, squirrels, raccoons) that may have taken up residence in your chimney.

    We can clean all kinds of stoves and fireplaces: wood stoves, gas fireplaces, open fireplaces, cook stoves, oil stoves, and pellet stoves. This includes completely removing and then cleaning out all internal parts of the stove.

    As an added bonus, we promise to leave your home as clean – or cleaner – as it was before we arrived!

    Our chimney cleaning and inspection services include:

    • Chimney inspection
    • Smoke shield cleaning
    • Brushing of the chimney flue
    • Cleaning and inspection of damper
    • Cleaning of firebox and then removing the ash
    • Removing the creosote, soot, and debris behind the flue damper
    • Inspection and cleaning of the chimney cap (if you have one)

    Our experienced chimney cleaning technicians use tarps, vacuums, shoe covers, and drop cloths to ensure your home stays clean throughout the job. We also use a wide range of rods and brushes to make sure every hint of soot is completely removed from your chimney and vents.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_custom_heading text=”Chimney Cleaning And Inspection: Your Satisfaction Is Guaranteed” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text]This is one of the nicest experiences I’ve ever had in regard to home maintenance and repair. The scheduling process was easy, the response was immediate, and the technician was thorough, knowledgeable and considerate. We found a nest of wasps in my chimney, so what should have been an easy inspection and cleaning ended up requiring three trips. Assaf wasn’t concerned about his time, in what turned out to be a complicated ordeal, as much as he was concerned about my safety. This makes me believe this is the UHS’s work ethic and culture.

    – Heidi Tracy

    Chimney cleaning and inspection can be a dangerous job because sometimes it’s hard to predict what kind of “surprises” have accumulated in there. So, it’s extremely important to choose a chimney cleaning company that’s insured, bonded, and licensed.

    United Home Services is a family-owned chimney sweeping company that’s been fully covered for 20+ years. We have been cleaning and maintaining chimneys in Texas, Maryland, Connecticut, Washington, and Pennsylvania since 1998.

    Winter is almost here which means you’re going to need your chimney and fireplace in tip-top condition. Don’t wait for a fire or carbon-monoxide accident to schedule a chimney cleaning!

     

    Call us today at 866-847-7454 or contact us online to schedule a chimney inspection.[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”Looking for High-Quality Roofing Services at Affordable Rates? United Home Services Is the Right Choice!” font_container=”tag:h2|text_align:left|color:%234169e1″ use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text]At United Home Services, our mission is to provide the highest quality roofing solutions at a reasonable price. We are known for our excellent craftsmanship and exceptional customer service.

    Every single technician in our roofing services team is highly skilled, properly trained, licensed, and insured. Whether you need your roof installed, repaired, or replaced, we can take care of it for you.

    To schedule a free roof inspection, call us today at 624-494-1164 or contact us online. [/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width=”stretch_row” css=”.vc_custom_1522185632641{margin-top: 20px !important;margin-bottom: 0px !important;}”][vc_column width=”1/6″ offset=”vc_hidden-sm vc_hidden-xs”][/vc_column][vc_column el_class=”contact-page-info” offset=”vc_col-md-8″][vc_row_inner css=”.vc_custom_1475832291472{margin-top: 30px !important;margin-bottom: 70px !important;}”][vc_column_inner width=”1/3″]

    [vc_custom_heading text=”Phone” font_container=”tag:h4|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1475591463116{padding-left: 50px !important;}”][vc_separator color=”custom” border_width=”6″ accent_color=”#edeceb” css=”.vc_custom_1475483735525{margin-bottom: 25px !important;}”][vc_custom_heading text=”Phone:” font_container=”tag:p|font_size:16px|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1522185011766{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}”][vc_custom_heading text=”800.399.4248″ font_container=”tag:p|font_size:22px|text_align:left|line_height:24px” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1607375189307{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}” el_class=”crea-primary-color” link=”url:tel%3A800-399-4248|||”][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/3″]
    [vc_custom_heading text=”Email” font_container=”tag:h4|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1475591474120{padding-left: 50px !important;}”][vc_separator color=”custom” border_width=”6″ accent_color=”#edeceb” css=”.vc_custom_1475483743286{margin-bottom: 25px !important;}”][vc_custom_heading text=”Our Email:” font_container=”tag:p|font_size:16px|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1522185003023{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}”][vc_custom_heading text=”info@ushometownservices.com” font_container=”tag:p|font_size:16px|text_align:left|color:%2300aedd” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1537809774037{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}” link=”url:mailto%3Ainfo%40ushometownservices.com|||”][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/3″]
    [vc_custom_heading text=”Address” font_container=”tag:h4|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1475591484965{padding-left: 50px !important;}”][vc_separator color=”custom” border_width=”6″ accent_color=”#edeceb” css=”.vc_custom_1475483752323{margin-bottom: 25px !important;}”][vc_custom_heading text=”Our Locations:” font_container=”tag:p|font_size:16px|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1522184832190{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}”][vc_custom_heading text=”Fort Lauderdale, Florida
    Kansas City, Missouri
    Las Vegas, Nevada
    Houston, Texas
    Fort Worth, Texas
    Richardson, Texas
    Allentown, Pennsylvania
    Seattle, Washington” font_container=”tag:p|font_size:17px|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1630344246659{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}” link=”url:http%3A%2F%2Funitedhomeserv.wpengine.com%2Fcase-studies%2F|||”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/6″ offset=”vc_hidden-xs”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width=”stretch_row” el_id=”contact” css=”.vc_custom_1522630509072{background-color: #4169e1 !important;}”][vc_column css=”.vc_custom_1522630538636{padding-top: 10px !important;padding-bottom: 5px !important;}”][vc_custom_heading text=”“Clean it Forward “” font_container=”tag:h2|text_align:center|color:%23ffffff” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1522630684204{padding-top: 5px !important;padding-bottom: 5px !important;}”][/vc_column][/vc_row]
